'''Holman the greenhanded''' was a famous gardener of [[the Shire]]. 

==History==
Holman of [[Hobbiton]] had five children; [[Rowan]], [[Halfred Greenhand|Halfred]], [[Erling]], [[Hending]] and [[Rose (daughter of Holman)|Rose]]. He passed his skills and crafts on to his eldest son, Halfred, who formed the surname [[Greenhand Family|Greenhand]] out of his father's nickname.<ref>{{App|Gamgee}}</ref> 

==Etymology==
Holman means "hole-man", and is distinct from the real-life English surname<ref name="Nomen">{{HM|N}}, p. 760</ref> which contains ''holm'' "river island" rather than ''hol'' "hole".<ref>{{HM|IE}}, "Giving of Names"</ref>
